name: imminence
content:

the state of being likely to happen very soon, or coming very soon: the imminence of danger The team needs to assess the imminence and likely impact of the next review. See
imminent
More examplesFewer examplesDespite the imminence of her departure, a successor has not yet been named.There was a sense of the imminence of some natural disaster. A storm seemed to be brewing but the sky cleared and the sense of imminence ended abruptly.
